title: Monash Freeway cow: Animal stranded near Clyde Road causes traffic delays
text:
Police and rangers are going to extreme lengths to ‘moo-ve’ the rogue cow that has caused traffic chaos on the Monash Freeway, attempting to ‘steer’ it off the major arterial with a bundle of hay on a piece of string.

The animal has remained on the busy stretch of road since 6.30am this morning, with a number of police cars, CityLink trucks and a crane called in to assist with the rescue.

Traffic has been affected between Kardinia Road and Clyde Road, with the right-hand closed and the speed limit reduced to just 40km/h.

Not really udder chaos on the Monash Freeway but look out for a cow slowing inbound traffic just after Clyde Road. Police have herd and are on scene with VicRoads crews to mooove the cow from the freeway. #victraffic #milkingitforpuns pic.twitter.com/3ANYNY0MXj — VicTraffic (@VicTraffic) October 10, 2019

Rick Gibson-Hards, 29, was tired driving home from a 12 hour shift about 6.30am and wasn’t sure he had seen the cow.

“I questioned myself,” Mr Gibson-Hards said.

“I wasn’t expecting to see a cow there.”

Mr Gibson-Hards said he was the first person to spot it and darted through peak hour traffic to get to the animal.

“For the love of animals, I had to,” he said.

Video footage from the scene.



She looks to be taking the fuss in her stride! pic.twitter.com/C1aNdbC0eL — 3AW Breakfast (@RossAndJohn) October 10, 2019

He parked his car in the outbound shoulder of the Monash Freeway, near the Clyde Road exit, about 40 metres behind the cow.

MORE: MAGISTRATE’S ‘FAMILY PLANS’ WITH YOUNG CLERK

RADICAL COUNCIL PLAN TO DRIVE CARS OUT OF CBD

Shortly after an undercover police car pulled in front of the cow and officers from VicRoads arrived.
description: Authorities are leaving no stone unturned when it comes to moo-ving the stranded cow from the Monash Freeway that has caused major delays on the busy stretch of road.
